net.jxta.impl.cm.sql
Class JdbcAdvertisementCache

java.lang.Object
  net.jxta.impl.cm.AbstractAdvertisementCache
      net.jxta.impl.cm.sql.JdbcAdvertisementCache
All Implemented Interfaces:
AdvertisementCache
Direct Known Subclasses:
DerbyAdvertisementCache, H2AdvertisementCache
public abstract class JdbcAdvertisementCache
extends AbstractAdvertisementCache

Apache Derby (though potentially any SQL99 DB) based advertisement cache.

Implementation notes:

  • A connection pool is used to deal with concurrent access, rather than attempting to synchronize access to a single connection.
  • We assume JDBC 3.0 prepared statement pooling is available in the database, rather than trying to hold on to PreparedStatement objects for as long as possible (impossible with the connection pool strategy in use).

getExpirationtime

public long getExpirationtime(String dn,
                              String fn)
                       throws IOException
Description copied from interface: AdvertisementCache
Returns the maximum duration in milliseconds for which this document should cached by those other than the publisher. This value is either the cache lifetime or the remaining lifetime of the document, whichever is less.

Parameters:
dn - contains the name of the folder
fn - contains the name of the file
Returns:
number of milliseconds until the file expires or -1 if the file is not recognized or already expired.
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs
